ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: As someone with a very limited background in filmmaking, I learned how the craft stories in a very foreign format. The course taught me how to condense very complex, multifaceted stories into something entertaining. The incredible films made my classmates also opened my eyes to a number of often overlooked issues.
This course gave me the space to explore and grow, not only as a filmmaker, but as a scholar. It's such a valuable addition to my education here!
I learned how to make films from almost no background.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The professor is one of the most experienced, credible, and caring filmmakers I have ever met and is the backbone of the course. The freedom to work on what you are passionate about and in whatever style feels best is a real privilege. While some of the screenings are helpful, others did not feel very relevant to any of our projects and were a big-time commitment. However, the screenings directed towards our own projects and the screenings of other students' work were invaluable.
The close-knit community and the direct mentorship and guidance of the professor are the biggest strengths of this course!
Really it just should be in person, also more technical help and help with structure.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The weekly meetings to discuss progress were incredibly helpful and motivational during the difficult times we were in. The only covid-related difficulty was the inability to get technical advice when we are all so far apart.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I absolutely would-especially if you are not a filmmaker. It was a fascinating exercise and allowed me to look at important issues through different perspectives. The art of filmmaking is incredibly challenging, but equally rewarding once you finish your project.

Yes! If you want to meet people who will inspire you and push you forward on your own growth journey, you should take this course! The progress everyone made was stunning and the connections in this class are truly unique! The Professor will help and guide you while being super understanding and supportive about the creative process and its challenges! I strongly recommend the class

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Some socially distanced office hours outside
